description: Construction of a part two/three/four storey building with 12 studio offices (B1) at ground, first and second floor levels and a 1 bed self-contained flat at third floor level with associated amenity space, parking (1 disabled space) and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years of the date of this permission.  REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policy 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The internal courtyard shall not be used in association with the adjoining public house or for any other recreational purpose other than as an amenity area for employees of the offices hereby permitted.  The area of land shall be landscaped in accordance with details submitted in connection with condition 3 of this permission.  REASON: To prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbours and to protect the appearance of the Haven Green Conservation Area in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.5 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No additional windows or other openings shall be created in the elevations of the building and no plant or machinery shall be installed anywhere outside the building without the permission of the Local Planning Authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.  REASON: To protect the character and appearance of the Conservation Area and the privacy of neighbouring residents and the quiet enjoyment of their homes in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No part of the development hereby permitted shall not be occupied until the pedestrian link bridge between the premises and the multi-storey car park shown on the drawing ref. 529/01 has been constructed and made available for use.  This bridge shall be permanently retained without obstruction thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that the use does not give rise to disturbance to neighbouring occupiers, that there is adequate access to car parking and in the interests of pedestrian and highway safety in accordance with policies 4.1 and 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No loading or unloading by delivery vehicles serving the site shall take place except between the hours of 0800 to 1800 Monday to Friday and 0900 to 1300 on Saturdays.  No deliveries shall take place on Sundays and Bank or Public Holidays.  REASON: To prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbouring residents in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The proposed refuse storage arrangements shown on the approved floor plans shall be implemented before the development is first brought into use and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure that suitable refuse storage facilities are provided and to prevent unacceptable disturbance to neighbouring residents in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The measures approved in the Travel Plan received by the Local Planning Authority on 8 August 2005 shall be implemented prior to the initial occupation of any part of the development hereby permitted, or in accordance with a programme set out in the Travel Plan, and shall be so maintained for the duration of the use, unless the prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority is obtained to any variation.  REASON: To ensure the Council's policies on sustainability are met in accordance with policies 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and to the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance, SPG 21 'Sustainable Transport: Green Travel Plans' | Details of measures to ensure access for all, including people with disabilities, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to initial occupation of any part of the building. The proposal shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to the commencement of the use and shall thereafter be permanently maintained.  REASON: To meet the needs of people with disabilities in accordance with policy 4.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and to the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance, SPG7 'Accessible Ealing'. | Details of all external lighting to be erected shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the development commencing.  The lighting as approved shall be installed prior to the first occupation of the development and permanently maintained in accordance with the approved standards thereafter.  REASON: To protect the security and living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies  4.1, 4.4 and 4.12 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The disabled parking, cycle parking and ground floor shower rooms shown on the approved plans shall be provided prior to first occupation of the development, and retained permanently for those purposes thereafter.  REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The ground floor windows in the north and west elevation of the building hereby permitted shall be fitted and permanently maintained with obscure glass.  REASON:  To prevent overlooking and protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of sound insulation and noise mitigation measures shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, for the insulation of the building envelope, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided.  The works shall be completed in accordance with the approved details before first occupation of the development and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON: To ensure the provision of a suitable work environment, in accordance with policy 4.11 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) 'New Plan for the Environment' | Crime DesignDetails of security and crime prevention measures, to comply with the aims and objectives of 'Secured by Design' shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, and any such details shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation of the development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.  REASON:  To help ensure the safety of future occupants, in accordance with policy 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and to the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance, SPG 8 'Safer Ealing' | Details of all proposed excavation works shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, and these works shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect the operation of the adjoining railway, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of all works within proximity to cutting slopes or retaining walls shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced, and these details shall demonstrate that land instability would not result.  These works shall be undertaken in accordance with the approved details and permanently retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect the operation of the adjoining railway, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
